verbose_text: CarD, a global regulator linked to the action of several extracytoplasmic function (ECF) sigma-factors, binds to the RNAP beta subunit (RNAP-beta) and to protein CarG via an N-terminal domain, CarDNt, and to DNA via an intrinsically unfolded C-terminal domain resembling eukaryotic high-mobility-group A (HMGA) proteins.
evidence: CarD, a global regulator linked to the action of several extracytoplasmic function (ECF) sigma-factors, binds to the RNAP beta subunit
